timeline.message: [Task 72498] added the searchByProperty endpoint on the Process endpoints
[Task 72498] rewrote ProcessQueryParameterContainer logic to have a map instead of set variables
[Task 72498] implemented the Sort option for the Process Search and added tests

timeline.bodyText: although this works, I would avoid searching on a null eperson UUID, and move this in the if block below
timeline.author: benbosman

timeline.bodyText: what will happen if it's not a valid status, is there an IT for this use case?
timeline.author: benbosman

replies.bodyText: If an invalid status is given, the valueOf call will throw an exception which will in turn be parsed to a BadRequest status code given by the REST api. I've added a test to verify this here: 13b59f9#diff-5c0eb5afe2a696f9d1a29faffc28ccc2R586
replies.author: Raf-atmire

timeline.bodyText:
why do you need to explicitly restrict to these values?
Is this because I mentioned them in the contract, because I simply copied it from https://github.com/DSpace/Rest7Contract/blob/main/processes-endpoint.md#execution-details
timeline.author: benbosman

replies.bodyText:
This explicit check has been removed. Since the actual code still retrieves the status using the existing enums this check is being done inherently through that piece of code.
When a status is being searched that does not exist, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
replies.author: jonas-atmire

timeline.bodyText:
can you also add a test with the other user ID (can be in the same method)
Otherwise you're only testing for the current user (the user from the token)
timeline.author: benbosman

timeline.bodyText: With the name searchProcessTestByUserSortedOnDefault, I did expect no sort parameters. Did I misinterpret the goal of this method?
timeline.author: benbosman

timeline.bodyText: isn't an invalid search option supposed to throw an exception?
timeline.author: benbosman

replies.bodyText: I've indeed altered this to throw an exception instead in the tests: 13b59f9#diff-5c0eb5afe2a696f9d1a29faffc28ccc2R782
replies.author: Raf-atmire
